formattedAddress: 120 Hudson St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 120 Hudson St, New York, NY 10013, USA

editorialSummary.text: Weekend brunch hot spot serving homestyle American eats with many locally sourced ingredients.

originalText.text: Recommended by friends and this was really worth a visit! I ordered a cherry pie and English breakfast tea as afternoon tea. My friend, by contrast, ordered grilled chicken breast and fries for some small bites. The cherry pie was a must-try. Though it was too sweet for me (and I am not a big fan of cinnamon), it still tasted great with my English breakfast tea. Grilled chicken breast and fries also tasted good with a fair proportion. Love the country style of the restaurant and it seemed to be pet-friendly ( I saw a dog dining in while having my meal).

originalText.text:
Great spot for breakfast and drinks! They offer seating inside and outside.
After waiting 20 min for a table we ended up sitting down at the bar.
Although the restaurant is super cramped the prompt service and good food made up for it. You will spend a pretty penny on a simple breakfast.
$18 for a drink and a simple eggs Benedict is $26.

originalText.text: Amazing brunch spot in Tribeca! The sour cream pancakes are a must, perfectly fluffy. We got them with bananas. On a lighter side, the green omelet with veggies was delicious. Service is quite slow, the place was packed. Prices are fair. There is a cute Photo Booth near the bathrooms!

text.text: Amazing brunch spot in Tribeca! The sour cream pancakes are a must, perfectly fluffy. We got them with bananas. On a lighter side, the green omelet with veggies was delicious. Service is quite slow, the place was packed. Prices are fair. There is a cute Photo Booth near the bathrooms!

originalText.text: What a fun place.   Lots of hustle and bustle to bring you huge portions of breakfast favorites.  The waiter was very good and even though pretty busy in there, no rush to move you along.  Enjoyed the people watching in there, looked like a mix of local and tourist.  I'd go back in a flash.  Fried chicken is to die for.

text.text: What a fun place.   Lots of hustle and bustle to bring you huge portions of breakfast favorites.  The waiter was very good and even though pretty busy in there, no rush to move you along.  Enjoyed the people watching in there, looked like a mix of local and tourist.  I'd go back in a flash.  Fried chicken is to die for.

originalText.text:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at Bubby’s Diner, a spot that has long been on my bucket list.

First and foremost, the food was absolutely delicious. I indulged in their spectacular pancakes and bacon mac & cheese, both of which were prepared to perfection and left my taste buds thoroughly satisfied. The flavors were rich and the portions were generous, making for a truly satisfying meal.

The ambiance of the diner was also noteworthy, with a fun and lively atmosphere that added to the overall experience. The highlight for me was the photo booth in the bathroom area, which added an extra element of entertainment to the day.

While the food and atmosphere were exceptional, the service fell short in some areas. Unfortunately, our orders were not delivered in the order we had requested. Despite the kitchen's claim of closing soon, it seemed as though other tables that were seated after us were still able to place their orders. This inconsistency was disappointing and left a slight blemish on an otherwise enjoyable day.

I rate my experience at four stars, primarily for the wonderful food and atmosphere.
